paper_abstract: We describe the research that has been performed in the field of the dynamic bandwidth allocation algorithm, interleaved polling with adaptive cycle time (IPACT), for Ethernet passive optical networks (EPON). The main focus has been on modeling packet delay analytically. To derive the packet delay, an important part of the analysis will also focus on the cycle time. It is assumed that the traffic load is symmetric, that packet arrivals are Poisson distributed, and that packets have fixed size. Simulations were performed to prove the accuracy of the analytical model. Some extensions and limitations of the model are treated, including asymmetric traffic load, packet size distribution, self-similar traffic, and differentiated services. (C) 2007 Optical Society of America.
paper_title: Analytical model for the IPACT dynamic bandwidth allocation algorithm for EPONs
